PlaqueOfCharisma.synopsis: Secret room in SCL_Main_A, beneath the Central Square. This statue has a dogma of Shar and asks you whether you accept it. Accepting it require a saving throw, on a failure you get a debuff and enemies appear. If you are a follower of Shar / Shadowheart you get have a special option which gives you auto-success.

Plaque_001_AD.synopsis: One of the plaque in the Central Square.You need to click on the 3 plaques in a correct sequence to unlock a secret entrance to the secret room underneath the central square.The correct sequence: 2-3-1The plaques should either tell the history of Ketheric Thorm / this outpost or be some sort of propaganda.

PAD_ExitLocked.synopsis: This PAD is played when you try to exit the secret room beneath the central square after three guardians were revealed to you, but before you defeated them.
PAD_ExitLocked.how_to_trigger: goto SCL_Main_A 236; 0; -839click on any plaquefail your saveuse ReCon command "peace"try to exit the place

PAD_PlaqueFirstUse.synopsis: Clicking on one of the plaquet at the central square in Town for the first time. The plaques must be pressed in the right order to unlock a secret room, and have what looks like nonsense written on them, but is actually the clue to the order.
PAD_PlaqueFirstUse.how_to_trigger: Go to the central square (SCL_Main_A -148.473; 28.635; -33.935)Click on one of the plaques.

PAD_EnteredSanctuary.synopsis: This PAD is played when you enter the secret Shar sanctuary beneath the Central Sqaure of the Town. It's free of the Shadow Curse and the player character comments on that.
PAD_EnteredSanctuary.how_to_trigger: Debug Book - Go To Region - Act 2 - TWN - Central Square Secret Room

AD_Justiciar.synopsis: There are piles and individual skeletons in justiciar сuirass scattered across the Town and SCL. We can click some of the most posing of them to get little narrator comment. Shadowheart may have followed up on this if we know about her justiciar connection.

SharAltar.synopsis: Altar dedicated to Shar. Has a ritual dagger on it. The altar appears when you activate three tapestries with dogmas of Shar.When the altar appears the door that leads outside gets locked. You need to recite the dogmas at the altar and spill your blood on it to open the door.If you a follower of shar you can do it with not issue and get a blessing.If you aren't a follower of shar, but you passed all the saving throws you can also get a blessing of shar by reciting the dogmas.If you didn't pass all the saving throws and perform a ritual then the guardians appear because you aren't worthy.If you desecrate the altar by taking the dagger then the guardians appear no matter who you are.
SharAltar.how_to_trigger: goto SCL_Main_A 236; 0; -839click on three tapestries and make a saving throwthe altar will appearclick on it

PlaqueOfWisdom.synopsis: Secret room in SCL_Main_A, beneath the Central Square. This statue has a dogma of Shar and asks you whether you accept it. Accepting it require a saving throw, on a failure you get a debuff and guardians appear. If you are a follower of Shar / Shadowheart you get have a special option which gives you auto-success.

Plaque_002_AD.synopsis: One of the plaque in the Central Square.You need to click on the 3 plaques in a correct sequence to unlock a secret entrance to the secret room underneath the central square.The correct sequence: 2-3-1The plaques should either tell the history of Ketheric Thorm / this outpost or be some sort of propaganda.

PlaqueOfIntelligence.synopsis: Secret room in SCL_Main_A, beneath the Central Square. This statue has a dogma of Shar and asks you whether you accept it. Accepting it require a saving throw, on a failure you get a debuff and guardians appear. If you are a follower of Shar / Shadowheart you get have a special option which gives you auto-success.

Plaque_003_AD.synopsis: One of the plaque in the Central Square.You need to click on the 3 plaques in a correct sequence to unlock a secret entrance to the secret room underneath the central square.The correct sequence: 2-3-1The plaques should either tell the history of Ketheric Thorm / this outpost or be some sort of propaganda.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: The analysis of the sessions revealed that certain events trigger others in a logical sequence. First, when the player visits the central square, they encounter the plaques. An initial session (PAD_PlaqueFirstUse) is triggered when any plaque at the central square is clicked for the first time. To unlock the secret entrance to the sanctuary below, the three plaques (Plaque_002_AD, Plaque_003_AD, Plaque_001_AD) must be activated in the correct sequence (2-3-1). Therefore, PAD_PlaqueFirstUse should occur before the first plaque press (Plaque_002_AD), and then Plaque_002_AD must be pressed before Plaque_003_AD, which in turn should be pressed before Plaque_001_AD. Successfully activating the plaques unlocks the secret entrance, which is confirmed by the session PAD_EnteredSanctuary when the player enters the sanctuary beneath the Central Square. Within the sanctuary, interacting with the three tapestries (activating them) causes the SharAltar to appear, thus locking the door. As a result, if the player subsequently attempts to exit the room before dealing with the guardians, PAD_ExitLocked is triggered; hence, SharAltar must precede PAD_ExitLocked. Moreover, there are multiple sessions related to clicking on a statue in the secret room (PlaqueOfCharisma, PlaqueOfWisdom, and PlaqueOfIntelligence) that, although they share almost identical mechanics (triggered by the statue and involving a saving throw), represent different dogmas (or attribute themes). Logically, the player would only experience one of these based on their character or choices, making them mutually exclusive. Other sessions (like AD_Justiciar) do not show any direct ordering or exclusivity constraints based on the provided information.

PlaqueOfCharisma_9.speaker: Narrator
PlaqueOfCharisma_9.text: *The statue looms silently. Whatever hidden purpose it has will remain a secret.*

PlaqueOfCharisma_12.speaker: Narrator
PlaqueOfCharisma_12.text: *Are you bold of heart and sharp of tongue? Can you turn any and all to the Dark Lady's cause?*
PlaqueOfCharisma_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks at the plaqueNodeContext: The text inscribed on a plaque at the base of a Shar statue

PlaqueOfCharisma_3.speaker: Narrator
PlaqueOfCharisma_3.text: *A deep, eldritch hum echoes in the corners of your mind. Your patron knows a thing or two about turning people.*

PlaqueOfCharisma_4.speaker: Player
PlaqueOfCharisma_4.text: Nod. With Shar's words on your tongue and teachings in your heart, none can deny you.

PlaqueOfCharisma_13.speaker: Narrator
PlaqueOfCharisma_13.text: *Confidence surges through you. You feel like there is nothing you can't do, no one you can't win over. The statue seems to agree - and approve.*
PlaqueOfCharisma_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: A faint purple aura glows from the statue

PlaqueOfCharisma_6.speaker: Player
PlaqueOfCharisma_6.text: You no longer bow to Shar, and do not need her blessings. You can take what you wish.

PlaqueOfCharisma_0.speaker: Player
PlaqueOfCharisma_0.text: Perhaps you could still win a modicrum of favour here, if you used all your charm and guile.

PlaqueOfCharisma_8.speaker: Narrator
PlaqueOfCharisma_8.text: *You feel your confidence wilt under the cold stare of the statue. A great weight of self-doubt seems to drag on you.*
PlaqueOfCharisma_8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player frowns as the room seems to shudder and darken. InternalNodeContext: Three Dark Justiciar undead will appear and attack in gameplay immediately after this

PlaqueOfCharisma_16.speaker: Player
PlaqueOfCharisma_16.text: Smirk. Of course. Need you even say it?

PlaqueOfCharisma_11.speaker: Player
PlaqueOfCharisma_11.text: Summon your faith and devotion - letting it flow through you.

PlaqueOfCharisma_15.speaker: Player
PlaqueOfCharisma_15.text: Allow your patron's ancient, immutable will to be glimpsed for but a moment.

PlaqueOfCharisma_14.speaker: Narrator
PlaqueOfCharisma_14.text: *The Nightsinger has turned on you. Surely whatever blessings she offers here are now lost to you... yet no harm in reading on, surely.*

PlaqueOfCharisma_21.speaker: Narrator
PlaqueOfCharisma_21.text: *The statue watches serenely. Its challenge has been met.*
PlaqueOfCharisma_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: A faint purple aura glows from the statue

Plaque_001_AD_0.speaker: Plaque
Plaque_001_AD_0.text:
F - L O S S
- P A I N
A L L S
L - R I S E

PAD_ExitLocked_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ExitLocked_0.text: Stuck. There's no leaving without a fight.

PAD_PlaqueFirstUse_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PlaqueFirstUse_0.text: Was that a click I heard? There's something about these plaques...

PAD_EnteredSanctuary_0.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteredSanctuary_0.text: The curse has no effect here - what is this place?

AD_Justiciar_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_Justiciar_0.text: *There is a darkness to these warriors that endures even now, long after their lives were spent. But who did they serve?*

AD_Justiciar_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_Justiciar_1.text: *Dark Justiciars, who fell long ago in service of Shar, and Ketheric Thorm.*

SharAltar_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stands before an altar of shar. There is no dagger present on it.

SharAltar_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stands before an altar of shar. Resting upon it is an ornate dagger.

SharAltar_12.speaker: Narrator
SharAltar_12.text: *Though you are outcast, Shar's dogma remains firmly entrenched in your mind. You know what this altar seeks - blood.*

SharAltar_7.speaker: Narrator
SharAltar_7.text: *An altar to Shar. It appears to seek pray, and a blood offering - your blood.*

SharAltar_9.speaker: Player
SharAltar_9.text: Take up the dagger, recite Shar's dogma, and cut your arm.

SharAltar_3.speaker: Player
SharAltar_3.text: Take up the dagger, recite Shar's wisdom and offer blood from your arm.

SharAltar_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: With the ritual dagger in their right hand, the player quickly sliced their left palm, wincing in pain.InternalNodeContext: Rewards will appear on two pedestals in gameplay following this node.

SharAltar_5.speaker: Narrator
SharAltar_5.text: *The altar's purpose is unclear - but the dagger upon it looks valuable.*

SharAltar_2.speaker: Player
SharAltar_2.text: The dagger won't be missed - take it.

SharAltar_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: The chamber around the player seems to darken and rumble ominously (camera shake) they glance around, on-edge,

PlaqueOfWisdom_1.speaker: Narrator
PlaqueOfWisdom_1.text: *The Lady of Loss has abandoned you. Whatever boon found here is no longer for you, surely... yet what harm in reading on?*

PlaqueOfWisdom_3.speaker: Narrator
PlaqueOfWisdom_3.text: *The statue gazes at you impassively. Its challenge has been met.*
PlaqueOfWisdom_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: A faint purple aura glows from the statue

PlaqueOfWisdom_7.speaker: Narrator
PlaqueOfWisdom_7.text: *Do you think yourself wise enough to be granted Shar's blessing?*
PlaqueOfWisdom_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: TWN_CentralSquare_PlaqueOfWisdomNodeContext: The text inscribed on a plaque at the base of a Shar statue

PlaqueOfWisdom_0.speaker: Player
PlaqueOfWisdom_0.text: Bow your head modestly. You are wise if Shar deems so. Ignorant if she deems so.

PlaqueOfWisdom_9.speaker: Narrator
PlaqueOfWisdom_9.text: *A warm swell rises through you. Acceptance - you are worthy.*
PlaqueOfWisdom_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: A faint purple aura glows from the statue

PlaqueOfWisdom_14.speaker: Player
PlaqueOfWisdom_14.text: You are wise enough to recognise Shar as a capricious, lying tyrant, yes.

PlaqueOfWisdom_2.speaker: Player
PlaqueOfWisdom_2.text: Show wisdom through understanding of how you have angered Lady Shar - that it cannot be undone.

PlaqueOfWisdom_5.speaker: Narrator
PlaqueOfWisdom_5.text: *The air seems to chill around you. Your claims of wisdom are rebuffed.*
PlaqueOfWisdom_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player frowns as the room seems to shudder and darken. InternalNodeContext: Three Dark Justiciar undead will appear and attack in gameplay immediately after this

PlaqueOfWisdom_11.speaker: Player
PlaqueOfWisdom_11.text: Nod. You feel like a veritable sage, after all you've experience of late.

PlaqueOfWisdom_12.speaker: Player
PlaqueOfWisdom_12.text: Nod. Your life is richer, wiser, with your god on your side.

PlaqueOfWisdom_8.speaker: Narrator
PlaqueOfWisdom_8.text: *The statue offers a mute stare, and nothing more. Any secret it guards will remain secret.*

Plaque_002_AD_0.speaker: Plaque
Plaque_002_AD_0.text:
O U R - L
M I S T R
W H E N - N I
T H O R M -

PlaqueOfIntelligence_0.speaker: Narrator
PlaqueOfIntelligence_0.text: *The statue offers you nothing but silence. Whatever secrets it may guard will remain hidden.*

PlaqueOfIntelligence_7.speaker: Narrator
PlaqueOfIntelligence_7.text: *Lady Shar has exiled you. It would be foolish to think you could enjoy any favours found here, surely... yet what do you have to lose from reading on?*

PlaqueOfIntelligence_10.speaker: Narrator
PlaqueOfIntelligence_10.text: *Do you accept Shar's test of your intellect?*
PlaqueOfIntelligence_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks at the plaqueNodeContext: The text inscribed on a plaque at the base of a Shar statue

PlaqueOfIntelligence_1.speaker: Player
PlaqueOfIntelligence_1.text: You are Shar's child - there is no reason to shy away. Nod in acceptance.

PlaqueOfIntelligence_12.speaker: Narrator
PlaqueOfIntelligence_12.text: *You feel a small pulse of energy race up your spine. And a strange sensation of acceptance.*
PlaqueOfIntelligence_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: A faint purple aura glows from the statue

PlaqueOfIntelligence_9.speaker: Player
PlaqueOfIntelligence_9.text: You are clear-headed regarding Shar: she is you foe now. Yet you are not above taking her power.

PlaqueOfIntelligence_13.speaker: Player
PlaqueOfIntelligence_13.text: Surely if there is any way to repair your relationship with Lady Shar, your mind is up to the task.

PlaqueOfIntelligence_11.speaker: Player
PlaqueOfIntelligence_11.text: Nod in acceptance. An untested mind is a dull mind.

PlaqueOfIntelligence_2.speaker: Player
PlaqueOfIntelligence_2.text: Let your faith and devotion guide you - if you are meant to pass this test, you will.

PlaqueOfIntelligence_5.speaker: Narrator
PlaqueOfIntelligence_5.text: *Your insides seem to churn uneasily. You feel strangely rejected. Strangely unwelcome.*
PlaqueOfIntelligence_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player frowns as the room seems to shudder and darken. InternalNodeContext: Three Dark Justiciar undead will appear and attack in gameplay immediately after this

PlaqueOfIntelligence_16.speaker: Narrator
PlaqueOfIntelligence_16.text: *It seems this statue has nothing to offer. Its challenge has been surmounted.*
PlaqueOfIntelligence_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: A faint purple aura glows from the statue

Plaque_003_AD_0.speaker: Plaque
Plaque_003_AD_0.text:
